intro: Psychotria molinarum, commonly known as the Molinarum Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, black, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various bird species. Psychotria molinarum is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses in traditional medicine.
